revised_title: Photographic Spectra of Some of the Brighter Stars: A Study of Stellar Spectra and the Meteoritic Hypothesis
tldr: The author analyzes photographic spectra of 171 stars, focusing on the finer details and classifications of their spectra. The study supports the meteoritic hypothesis, suggesting that celestial bodies are or have been swarms of meteorites, and discusses the implications of this hypothesis on the classification of stars and the evolution of celestial bodies.
